cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 300 mi SW of the mouth of the Mississippi River and 310 mi E of the mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to slow, turn west later Saturday, then drift northwest Sunday–Monday, gradually approaching the upper-middle Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along the Texas coast between Port Aransas and High Island (near Matagorda/Freeport area, roughly southwest of Galveston)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Aransas, TX to High Island, TX (hurricane); Port Mansfield, TX to High Island, TX including Galveston Bay (storm surge)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwest Gulf Coast from south-central Texas to southwest Louisiana, including Galveston Bay region
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible at Galveston by late Sunday; a few hurricane-force gusts can’t be ruled out Monday if Beta reaches minimal hurricane strength before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level possible in and around Galveston Bay under the Storm Surge Watch.
weather_observation.rainfall: Slow movement could bring prolonged heavy rains; 4–8 inches with locally higher totals are possible early next week, producing flooding in low-lying port areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and minor coastal flooding beginning this weekend; operations may also be affected by reduced visibilities in squalls.
